raw_text:
Bafta to hand out movie honours
 
 Movie stars from across the globe are attending this year's Bafta film award ceremony.
 
 British stars Imelda Staunton and Clive Owen are hoping for awards at the Odeon in London's Leicester Square. Hollywood stars Leonardo diCaprio, Pierce Brosnan, Christian Slater and Richard Gere are also in the audience for the biggest night in UK film. Hollywood blockbuster The Aviator, starring DiCaprio, leads the field with 14 nominations, including best movie. It is up against Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Finding Neverland, The Motorcycle Diaries and British film Vera Drake, which has 11 nominations.
 
 Staunton is one of the favourites to land the best actress award for her gritty role as a backstreet abortionist in the small-budget film. She arrived at the ceremony wearing a green silk and chiffon low cut evening dress decorated with beads. "It's lovely to be here at home, to be on British soil. It's very nice indeed," she told reporters.
 
 Asked whether she was nervous about her best actress nomination she said: "It's out of my hands, there's nothing I can do. I'm here with a lot of mates and we're going to have a very nice evening." Other nominees in the best actress category include Charlize Theron for Monster, Ziyi Zhang for House of Flying Daggers and UK star Kate Winslet, who has two nods for her roles in Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and Finding Neverland. DiCaprio faces competition from Bernal, Jamie Foxx, Jim Carrey and Johnny Depp in the best actor category. The crowed screamed when he arrived on the red carpet."It's unlike anything I've ever encountered. It's very intense and very loud," he told the BBC.
 
 "It's the first time I've come to the Baftas because it's the first time I've been nominated...I've appreciated British cinema for a long time and to be recognised like this is a special honour." Gere, who is presenting the best film award, said: "It's a big party, I had no idea it was going to be this big. It's crazy, I think it's bigger than the Academy Awards."
 
 British actor Owen is hoping to repeat his Golden Globe success with a best supporting actor award for his role in Closer. He raised one of the biggest cheers of the night when he walked down the red carpet. "I was always a huge fan of Closer as a play, so when I got the call to appear in the film, it was a huge thrill for me," he said. "The whole experience has been a treat and I'm very fortunate to have been given the role." His co-star Natalie Portman is up against Blanchett, Heather Craney, Julie Cristie and Meryl Streep in the best supporting actress category. Mike Leigh is up for the best director award for Vera Drake, alongside Martin Scorsese for The Aviator, Michael Mann for Collateral, Michel Gondry for Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and Marc Forster for Finding Neverland.
 
 The Orange British Academy Film Awards will be shown on BBC One at 2010 GMT.

qwen2.5:1.5b: The Bafta film awards are taking place in London's Leicester Square with prominent international actors like Imelda Staunton, Clive Owen, Leonardo DiCaprio and others attending. Among the nominations: The Aviator (DiCaprio), Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Finding Neverland, Vera Drake, Monster, House of Flying Daggers, Kate Winslet, Charlize Theron, Ziyi Zhang, and more. Bafta stars include Mike Leigh for "Vera Drake" and Martin Scorsese for "The Aviator."
qwen2.5:3b: Bafta film award ceremony features movie stars including Imelda Staunton, Clive Owen, Leonardo DiCaprio, Pierce Brosnan, Christian Slater, and Richard Gere. DiCaprio's "The Aviator" leads with 14 nominations. Staunton is a favorite for best actress for her role in "Vera Drake," which has 11 nominations. The event is described as the biggest night in UK film. Owen hopes to repeat his Golden Globe success with a best supporting actor award, and Mike Leigh is nominated for best director for "Vera Drake." The ceremony will be broadcast on BBC One at 20:10 GMT.
opencoder:1.5b:
The text summarizes the following:

1. A movie honours ceremony is held with a couple of key nominees from across the globe, including top British stars Imelda Staunton and Clive Owen.
2. The Oscar winners for their roles in "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind", "Finding Neverland" and "Vera Drake" have all won the award.
3. The Golden Globes winner for "Closer" also won for "The Motorcycle Diaries".
4. The best supporting actor nominations include Owen for "Closer" and Portman for "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind". The director award is also included, although not in a position-specific way.
5. The biggest night in UK film awards include Steven Spielberg's "Inglourious Basterds" with five nominations, including Best Director and Best Actor. It is also a Best Picture in its own right.
6. "It's like I've never felt the thrill of being a part of a big night." Clive Owen has been onstage for over 30 minutes, and asked about his enthusiasm at the ceremony.

It does not provide explanations or reasoning processes, as it is a factual summary of the event. The summary only includes the most important information about the winners and nominees in each category.

tinydolphin:1.1b:

Dolphin, an AI assistant, summarized the main highlights of the evening:

2. Bafta is the biggest awards night in UK film, with stars from across the globe in attendance. This year, there were 14 nominations for best movie, with Leonardo DiCaprio leading the field with 14 nominations. The British star Imelda Staunton is also hoping for awards, while Hollywood actors Leonardo DiCaprio and Pierce Brosnan are both nominated for Best Actor in a Supporting Role.

3. The Odeon Theater in London's Leicester Square was the venue for this year's Bafta film awards ceremony.

4. This year's winners will be announced during the live broadcast on BBC One at 20:10 GMT, making it an exciting night for audiences and industry professionals alike.

5. Overall, the event was filled with excitement and anticipation for this year's winners, with fans and celebrities in attendance to witness the best of British and international cinema.

granite3.1-dense:2b:
This year's BAFTA film award ceremony, held in London's Leicester Square, brings together global movie stars for the UK's premier film event. Notable attendees include British actors Imelda Staunton and Clive Owen, as well as Hollywood stars Leonardo DiCaprio, Pierce Brosnan, Christian Slater, and Richard Gere.

DiCaprio's epic biographical film, The Aviator, leads with 14 nominations, including best movie. Other notable contenders are Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Finding Neverland, The Motorcycle Diaries, and British film Vera Drake (11 nominations).

Staunton is a top favorite for best actress, praised for her role as an abortionist in Vera Drake. She expressed excitement about being on British soil during the ceremony. Other competitors include Charlize Theron (Monster), Ziyi Zhang (House of Flying Daggers), and Kate Winslet (Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Finding Neverland).

DiCaprio vies for best actor against Bernal, Jamie Foxx, Jim Carrey, and Johnny Depp. Gere, presenting the best film award, described the event as "crazy" and bigger than the Academy Awards. Owen hopes to replicate his Golden Globe win for best supporting actor in Closer.

The ceremony will be broadcast on BBC One at 2010 GMT, featuring Mike Leigh (Vera Drake), Martin Scorsese (The Aviator), Michael Mann (Collateral), Michel Gondry (Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind), and Marc Forster (Finding Neverland) in contention for best director.
